abstract:
Based on $(2712.4\pm14.1)\times10^{6}~\psi(2S)$ events, 7.9 fb$^{-1}$
$\psi(3773)$ data, and 0.8 fb$^{-1}$ off-resonance data samples collected with
the BESIII detector, we measure the branching fraction of
$\psi(2S)\rightarrow\gamma\pi^{0}$ and $e^{+}e^{-}\rightarrow\gamma\pi^{0}$
form factor at momentum transfers $Q^{2}\sim13$ GeV$^{2}$. The
$e^{+}e^{-}\rightarrow\gamma\pi^{0}$ cross section is fitted with considering
the interference between the $\psi(2S)$ and continuum amplitudes and two
solutions are found, ${\cal B}=3.74\times10^{-7}$ with $\phi=3.93$ rad and
${\cal B}=7.87\times10^{-7}$ with $\phi=2.08$ rad. Here, ${\cal B}$ is the
branching fraction of $\psi(2S)\rightarrow\gamma\pi^{0}$ and $\phi$ is the
relative phase angle between the $\psi(2S)$ and continuum amplitudes. Due to
insufficient off-resonance data, the branching fraction ${\cal
B}(\psi(2S)\rightarrow\gamma\pi^{0})$ is determined to be in the range $[2.7,
9.7]\times10^{-7}$ within one standard deviation of the contour region.
